Utterance: Hi, it's Ellie again. I'm glad to see you back today. How have you been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie. I've had a rough few days, to be honest. Just feeling overwhelmed with everything.
I'm sorry to hear that. Can you tell me a bit more about what's been overwhelming for you?
Well, work has been really stressful lately. I feel like I'm juggling too many responsibilities and it's just wearing me down.
That sounds tough. Are there specific aspects of your work that are contributing to this stress?
Yeah, I have a project that's behind schedule, and my boss is breathing down my neck about it. I feel like I'm constantly being watched.
It sounds like you're feeling a lot of pressure. How do you usually cope with stress at work?
I try to take breaks when I can, but sometimes I just end up working through them. I guess I feel guilty if I take time off.
Guilt can be a heavy burden to carry. Have you had a chance to talk to anyone at work about how you're feeling?
Not really. I don't want to seem weak or like I can't handle my job.
I understand that concern. It can be hard to open up, especially in a work environment. But sometimes sharing your feelings can help lighten the load.
Yeah, I guess so. But I worry about what they might think of me.
That’s a common fear. What if we explored some ways to express your feelings without feeling vulnerable?
Okay, that could be helpful.
Great! One option could be to write down your thoughts. Journaling can help you process your feelings without the pressure of immediate feedback. Have you ever tried that?
I used to journal a lot when I was younger, but I haven't in years.
It could be a good way to reconnect with your feelings. Maybe start with just a few minutes each day?
Yeah, I could give that a shot.
Awesome! How about your sleep? You mentioned having trouble staying asleep. Has that improved at all?
Not really. I still wake up a lot, usually thinking about work or my mom.
That sounds really challenging. Have you tried any techniques to help with your sleep?
I've tried some breathing exercises, but they don’t always work.
Breathing exercises can be helpful. Would you be open to trying a guided meditation before bed?
I think I could try that.
Great! I can help you find some resources for that. It might help calm your mind before sleep.
That sounds good, thanks.
You mentioned that your eating habits have changed since your mom passed. How are you feeling about that now?
I’m still struggling with it. I eat when I’m stressed, and then I feel guilty afterward.
It’s understandable to seek comfort in food during tough times. What if we explored some alternative coping strategies together?
Like what?
For instance, physical activity can be a great way to relieve stress. Have you considered incorporating more movement into your routine?
I used to love hiking, but I haven’t gone in a while.
Hiking could be a wonderful way to reconnect with something you love. Would you be willing to set a small goal to go hiking this week?
Yeah, I think I could do that.
Fantastic! Setting a specific day and time can help make it happen.
I’ll try to go on Saturday morning.
That sounds perfect! And how do you feel about the idea of sharing your feelings with your partner?
I haven't really talked to them about how I'm feeling lately.
It might be helpful to let them in on what you're going through. You don’t have to carry this alone.
Yeah, I think I’ll try to talk to them tonight.
That’s a great step forward! Remember, it's okay to ask for support.
Thanks, Ellie. I appreciate your help.
Of course! I’m here for you. So, to recap, we’ll work on journaling, try guided meditation, plan that hike, and talk to your partner.
Sounds like a plan.
I’m looking forward to hearing how it goes next time. Take care, and see you soon!
Bye, Ellie.
